instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage in backlight area and power cycling. Replaced everything affected by the spill. Now turns with caps light working but still nothing on the screen. There is a section of the board that has a broken trace from a 6 leg chip to a capacitor but cant find a schematic or boardview to see where it goes. External works.

Tried with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but backlight area is layed out different.

Anybody know how to get a boardview for this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message:
You should get another board for test.
Then poke around that broken trace with several points, where you think should have continuity.
